Copy Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone -------- Original message -------- From: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov Date: 8/16/19 8:20 PM (GMT-05:00) To: Marti Licon-Vitale (b)(6) @bop.gov, James Petrucci (b)(6) @bop.gov Subject: Fwd: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein >>> "Lee Plourde" 08/16/2019 20:21 >>> Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone -------- Original message -------- From: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) @bop.gov Date: 8/16/19 6:57 PM (GMT-05:00) To: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov Subject: Fwd: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein >>> (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) 08/16/2019 18:57 >>> Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone
-------- Original message --------
From: Nancy Ayers (b)(6) @bop.gov
Date: 8/16/19 5:4
Subject: Re: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein
>>> "Nancy Ayers" (b)(6) @bop.gov 08/16/2019 17:45 >>> (b)(6) told off on this - no need to respond... I have given (b)(6) guidance....we'll handle it.. thanks Nancy Ayers Chief, Office of Public Affairs Federal Bureau of Prisons U.S. Department of Justice 202-514 (b)(6) >>> BOP-IPP/Public Affairs 8/16/2019 5:34 PM >>> (b)(5) Office of Public Affairs Information, Policy and Public Affairs Division Federal Bureau of Prisons (202) 514-6551 - phone (202) 514-6620 - fax (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) @tmz.com 8/16/2019 5:05 PM >>> Do you have the results of his autopsy?

text_blocks.content: Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone
Subject: Fwd: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein
Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone
Subject: Fwd: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein
Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone

-------- Original message --------
From: Nancy Ayers (b)(6) @bop.gov
Date: 8/16/19 5:4
Subject: Re: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein
(b)(6) told off on this - no need to respond... I have given (b)(6) guidance....we'll handle it.. thanks
Information, Policy and Public Affairs Division
Do you have the results of his autopsy?

additional_notes: The document appears to be a redacted email chain discussing a media inquiry related to Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy results. The redactions are extensive, with many names, email addresses, and phone numbers obscured.
